name: What Rhymes with Slime? Trivia Game | Words for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which word rhymes with TRAY, HEY, and NEIGH?
questions.explanation:
sleigh.

	I hear a neigh. "Hey, Lady," I say, "D'you want some hay?" "OK," Lady neighs.

questions.text: Which word rhymes with KEY, FLEA, and TREE?
questions.explanation:
fee.

	"What's your fee for a flea bath, Kiki?" "Three dollars," said she.

questions.text: Which word rhymes with FLY, SIGH, and PIE?
questions.explanation:
eye.

	"What's that speck on your slice of pie?" "A fly," I sighed.

questions.text: Which word rhymes with OH, SO, and SEW?
questions.explanation:
dough.

	Said Chloe, "I love cookie dough SO much!" "Oh?" said Joe.

questions.text: Which word rhymes with YOU, TRUE, and DO?
questions.explanation:
chew.

	Do you chew stew and fruit on Tuesdays?

questions.text: Which word rhymes with SKATE, PLATE, and WAIT?
questions.explanation:
eight.

	Kate, please put eight plates on the table. By the way, the name Leigh rhymes with TREE.

questions.text: Which word has the same ending sound as LEAK, SQUEAK, and UNIQUE?
questions.explanation:
meek.

	"Squeak!" said a meek mouse as it peeked out of its hole. Unique means "one of a kind." English words such as unique, boutique (a cute little shop), and clique (a group) come from the French language.

questions.text: Which word has the same ending sound as with MAIN, SANE, and CAMPAIGN?
questions.explanation:
sprain.

	During his campaign, Mr. Lane sprained his foot. The pain is driving him insane. A political campaign is an effort to get people to vote for you in an election.

questions.text: Which word rhymes with FLAKE, CAKE, and BREAK?
questions.explanation:
ache.

	I ate eight slices of cake. Now I have a stomach ache.

questions.text: Which word rhymes with BROOM, FUME, and ZOOM?
questions.explanation:
tomb.

	Flowers bloom beside the soldier's tomb. A tomb is a kind of grave, or a building where people bury their dead.
